There is a great PDF to CBR application that you can queue hundreds of items up and go afk for.  I use it for saving Heroes pdfs into CBRs, it's called PDF2CBR.  I don't remember where I got it from anymore, but you should be able to find it in a quick google search (or it might be a torrent here).
Quit whinin', use Java-Comix at Sourceforge, and thank hakonfl.

We all bow our heads in reverence at your glory for putting this up and continuing to seed. Amen, let's kick some ass.

Just finished reading Preacher comics.It turned out to be a very pleasant surprise indeed.
Started off a bit silly but as it progressed,it sort of grows in you.
The main thing that adds credit to the comics is the great story-telling and the even greater character development.A must read for all those guys who will not be offended by the violence and the sheer amount of profanity(principally against god) in it. :)

Rating: 9/10.
Note: Like somebody said in a comment here at tpb, Cassidy alone is worth reading this one.

The proper order here should be ...and I don't know the issue numbers since I have the graphic novels and not the individual comics. So they are by volume. 


/Preacher (US) - (Vol. 1) - Gone to Texas.pdf	

/Preacher (US) - (Vol. 2) - Until the end of the World.pdf	
/Preacher (US) - (Vol. 3) - Proud Americans.pdf	

/Preacher (US) - Vol. 4 ) - ANCIENT HISTORY
which consists of : saint of killers, the story of you know how, and the good ol boys
